docs.name: outbreak:ComputationalTool
docs.label: ComputationalTool
docs.description: This is the Computational Tool schema for describing software and other computational tools for outbreak.info resources.

properties.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool.
properties.label: codeRepository

properties.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool. Please use terms from the ‘Programming language’ table in the Bio.Tools documentation
properties.label: programmingLanguage

properties.description: The author of this resource, content, or rating
properties.label: author

properties.description: Date the record was created
properties.label: dateCreated

properties.description: Date of first broadcast/publication
properties.label: datePublished

properties.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed
properties.label: dateModified

properties.description: keywords for describing the record
properties.label: keywords

properties.description: A doi if available
properties.label: doi

properties.description: Funding that supports (sponsors) the collection of this dataset through some kind of financial contribution
properties.label: funding

properties.description: Species(es) from which dataset has been collected
properties.label: species

properties.description: infectious agents(s) which are the focus of the dataset
properties.label: infectiousAgent

properties.description: The disease or medical conditions caused by the infectious agent. Important as some agents may cause multiple diseases
properties.label: infectiousDisease

properties.description: Applicable outbreak.info category
properties.label: topicCategory

properties.description: A citation to a resource (eg- publication, protocol, etc.) on which this resource was derived (stored as an object, not a string)
properties.label: isBasedOn

properties.description: A citation to a resource (eg- publication, protocol, etc.) which is related to the resource but is not a derivative nor was derived from the resource (stored as an object, not a string)
properties.label: isRelatedTo

properties.description: A citation to a resource (eg- publication, protocol, etc.) which is derived from this resource (stored as an object, not a string)
properties.label: citedBy

properties.description: The source from which this Dataset was identified for inclusion into Outbreak.info. Provides provenance for a resource which was curated by another.
properties.label: curatedBy

properties.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.
properties.label: curationDate

properties.description: One or more reviews, ratings, or other evaluations of this resource
properties.label: evaluations

name.description: Short, descriptive title for the computational tool.

description.description: Longer description of what was contained in the computational tool. For example, computational tool fields, ....

author.description: person, people, or organization that created the computational tool.

affiliation.description: A barebones Organization object to work around recursion issues in DDE

alternateName.description: Alternate name or Acronym for the organization.

oneOf.description: Reusable person definition accounting for recursion issues in DDE

funding.description: Funding for the generation of the computational tool.

oneOf.description: Information about funding support

name.description: The name of the monetary grant that funded/funds the Computational Tool

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Computational Tool

alternateName.description: Alternate name or Acronym for the organization.

name.description: The name of the monetary grant that funded/funds the Computational Tool

identifier.description: Unique identifier(s) for the grant(s) used to fund the Computational Tool

alternateName.description: Alternate name or Acronym for the organization.

items.description: A barebones Organization object to work around recursion issues in DDE

alternateName.description: Alternate name or Acronym for the organization.

species.description: Species(es) for which the Computational Tool has been developed

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

infectiousAgent.description: infectious agents(s) for which the Computational Tool has been developed

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

infectiousDisease.description: The disease or medical conditions caused by the infectious agent. Important as some agents may cause multiple diseases

oneOf.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

items.description: collection of vocabulary terms defined in ontologies

identifier.description: An identifier for the dataset, preferably a doi

doi.description: The DOI for the computational tool if available

license.description: License associated with re-use of the computational tool.

programmingLanguage.description: The main programming language(s) used to build or execute the tool. Please use terms from the ‘Programming language’ table in the Bio.Tools documentation

applicationSubCategory.description: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'. Use an EDAM:Topic to describe the category of application

applicationCategory.description: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'. Please use terms from the 'Tool type' table in the biotools documentation.

softwareVersion.description: Version(s) of the tool, which this information is valid for. Can also be a comma-delimited list and include hyphen-separated ranges of versions.

codeRepository.description: Link to the source code repository of the tool.

featureList.description: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications). Functionality provided by the tool. Note: Bioschemas have removed Text from the Expected Types.

isBasedOn.description: A citation to a resource (eg- publication, protocol, etc.) on which this dataset was derived (stored as an object, not a string)

oneOf.description: A citation object for a resource which is cited by the Computational Tool (ie- is a derivative of the Computational Tool) , related to the Computational Tool, or from which the Computational Toolwas based on (ie- is derived from).

name.description: Name of or title of the citation

identifier.description: An identifier associated with the citation

url.description: The url of the resource cited.

versionDate.description: The version date of the resource used at the time of the creation of the citation as certain resources (protocols, datasets) may change frequently over time.

citeText.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced resource as is provided

curationDate.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.

citeText.description: The bibliographic citation for the referenced resource as is provided

curationDate.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.

curationDate.description: The date this resource was added into outbreak.info, or was updated in outbreak.info.

docs.name: schema:Thing
docs.label: Thing
docs.description: The most generic type of item.

properties.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.
properties.label: sameAs

properties.description: URL of the item.
properties.label: url

properties.description: An alias for the item.
properties.label: alternateName

properties.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.
properties.label: image

properties.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.
properties.label: additionalType

properties.description: The name of the item.
properties.label: name

properties.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.
properties.label: identifier

properties.description: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing.
properties.label: subjectOf

properties.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.
properties.label: potentialAction

properties.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.
properties.label: mainEntityOfPage

properties.description: A description of the item.
properties.label: description

properties.description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.
properties.label: disambiguatingDescription
